title: What is the significance of the symbolism of the Fedeli d'Amore in relation to other initiatic movements, especially alchemy, and how does it relate to the controversial publication of the 'Mistero dell'Amor Platonico' in the Rossetti household?
first_phrase: In the earlier part of this text, the author discusses the symbolism of the Fedeli d'Amore movement and its comparison with other initiatic movements, especially alchemy. In the last 200 tokens, the author refers to an unpublished epistolary of Rossetti, which reveals that he requested the preservation of a book that had been printed and financed by Hookam Freer. The book, "Mistero dell'Amor Platonico," was kept at Rossetti's home for many years before being destroyed by his widow after his death. The author also mentions a correction proposed by Hercole Quadrelli to his interpretation of a sonnet by Cecco d'Ascoli, where the word "Rodico" may mean "follower of the Rose." In the end, the author highlights an article dedicated to his book by René Guénon, a well-known scholar of initiatic traditions who wrote "L'esoterismo di Dante."
